page.title: 02SITE OF AVERHAM
page.content: The site of the small,select village of Averham is in the flat Trent Valley.It is four miles from Newark, three miles from Southwell and twenty miles from Nottingham.Averham consists mainly of expensive,private houses and tied cottages and the population of 189 is static because there has been very little re-building for many years.Thus the community consists of mainly older people because people with families find the existing homes too expensive. The River Trent flows round the village.The school,church and the theatre are the only meeting points as the area has no shop or Public House. All school occasions are well supported.The church and the theatre are built on the higher land and there has been no recent evidence of river flooding in the Averham area.
